cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi (140 km) ESE of Progreso, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest over the southern Gulf today, forecast to turn north then north-northeast and accelerate toward the northern Gulf Coast, aiming for southeastern Louisiana–Mississippi coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana (roughly between Morgan City and the mouth of the Mississippi River)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana (Tropical Storm Watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City, Louisiana, to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana coast from Intracoastal City eastward through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (40–50 mph) possible Wednesday afternoon-night with a small chance (≈1%) of minimal hurricane-force gusts
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge of 2–4 ft forecast for Lake Pontchartrain; little direct surge expected as port lies well upriver
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely with isolated amounts up to 6 inches Wednesday–early Thursday, producing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado risk Wednesday–Wednesday night; possible river level rise on the lower Mississippi affecting terminal operations
